title: Frequently Asked Questions
description: Find answers to common questions about our holistic therapy services. If you can't find what you're looking for, please feel free to contact us.

items.question: What is the difference between Deep Tissue Treatment and Remedial/Clinical Massage?
items.answer:
Think of a Deep Tissue Treatment as a way to address general "all-over" stiffness and chronic tension using slow, firm pressure on the deeper muscle layers.

**Remedial / Clinical Treatment** is more like a "detective" session. I focus specifically on a functional problem—such as Tennis Elbow, a restricted shoulder, or a recent strain. These sessions include more assessment and targeted techniques to restore movement to a specific area.

items.question: Why is the Remedial Treatment sometimes a shorter duration?
items.answer: In clinical work, the goal is a specific therapeutic change. Overworking a sensitive or injured area for a full hour can lead to "tissue fatigue" or excessive soreness the next day. A focused 45-minute session is often the "sweet spot" for the body to accept change and begin the healing process.

items.question: Does "Deep Tissue" mean it will be painful?
items.answer: Not at all. Effective deep tissue work is about depth, not just pressure. I work *with* your nervous system, not against it. While you may feel some "productive discomfort" as a knot releases, you should never feel the need to hold your breath or tense up.

items.question: I’m not sure which treatment I need. Can you help?
items.answer: Absolutely\! Most clients aren't 100% sure, and that is why every session includes a consultation. I will discuss your goals—whether it’s pain relief, increased mobility, or stress reduction—and recommend the best approach for your body that day.

items.question: Is Seated Chair Massage "easier" than Table Massage?
items.answer: It is different, but just as effective\! It is a fantastic option for those who find lying face-down uncomfortable, have mobility issues, or are in the later stages of pregnancy. You receive the same high level of clinical skill and care, just in a more accessible, upright position.

items.question: Is there a consultation fee?
items.answer:
No. A thorough consultation is essential for safe and effective treatment. The time spent discussing your health and goals is **in addition** to your hands-on massage time and is included in the treatment price.

*Still unsure? I’m always happy to have a quick chat to ensure you book the treatment that’s right for you. Send me a message via my Facebook page, via WhatsApp, or send me an email at susan.chinnery@holistictherapyclinic.co.uk*
